data.title: Delicious brunch
data.text: We stopped in here after having a terrible experience in another restaurant in Eagan and had a wonderful breakfast. My kids & I split a large plate which had a french toast bake with apples,eggs, hash browns, sausage and bacon and it was delicious. The service was excellent and I will definitely be returning here

data.title: Dinner at bar
data.text:
Service a bit slow to start but improved during the meal.  Steak was good but the signature walleye. Not so much 

Nice atmosphere.

data.title: Very much liked the meal
data.text: We went with a big group.  The drinks were good.  A wide variety of BBQ style food.  I enjoyed the chicken and brisket meal I ordered.  Not romantic and no real ambiance.

data.title: Exceptional Service and Great Atmosphere
data.text:
The atmosphere is perfect reminds me of a local waterhole except for the fact the brilliance of the young bartender who I believe you could come here tonight and order a drink and come back 3 months later and he would remember your drink.
It was a great experience.

data.title: Tasty Foods
data.text: The facility is nicely decorated. The food is very tasty. Great family restaurant. The staff is nice. Bloody Mary bar on Saturday, plus breakfast items available later in the day.

data.title: Moderate dining
data.text:
My husband and I dine here when we when we want to hear each other and not everyone around us. The menu is no big deal but I always find something. I particularly like the Asian chicken salad and surprising my husband does too. 
The drinks are fair but I'm a lightweight
Always robotic service, I think they over train, I've never seen a hint of a personality

data.title: Good food... terrible service
data.text: We frequent another Bonfire which we love! So while in the area in Eagan we decided to stop here for something familiar. However this one was not up to par to the other location we love. Same atmosphere and food was good but we were appalled by our server. Started with being greeted rudely and it continued to go down hill from there. We noticed how rude she was to her other tables around us as well.  I would rather give the service 0 stars than 1 star. Will never be back to this specific location due to how we were treated. I have never left a restaurant as upset as I did this night. There are other Bonfires in the area that I would highly recommend over this one any day.

data.title: Great food, excellent service
data.text: Lovely outdoor patio and large indoor area.  We visited late on  a Sunday afternoon and had dinner. No problem with being seated or served right away without reservations.  We loved the food and service!

data.title: Like the update
data.text: We had not eaten here in quite a while and were impressed with the menu and decor update.   I had the matador burger. It was good but quite messy with things falling out of it.  My wife loved the tomato basil soup.  One of the kids had chicken fingers and if they make the same things for adults I would order them.  Our daughter liked the cheese burger and it was large enough that she ate it throughout the day.  We will be back more often.

data.title: Great Serivce and good food
data.text: Eight of us went as a family on a Saturday night.  We were seated promptly by a very courteous hostess.  We had no reservations but it did not matter.  We managed to get our cold drinks quickly, which was great as the day had been extremely hot.  Two mugs of Summit EPA disappeared far too quickly.  We decided to go light on the meal so my wife and I each ordered a salad, an Asian Salad for $11.95 and a Chopped Salad for $11.95. (I have always wondered how lettuce can cost so much, but nevertheless, they were both good.)  We again had Allison as our waitress, who is absolutely the best.  She is courteous, very efficient, and very friendly.  She is helpful and straight forward in her explanation of the menu items.  If you go there, you should ask for a table in her area.  You will not regret it.  (she surprised us by remembering us from our last visit and remembered exactly where we sat)  Impressive.  I give this place a thumbs up!

data.title: A fun family dinner
data.text: I don't know why this place has a cow hanging from the ceiling but it does and my boys lived it. They also loved the hamburgers and home made fries. I loved the baked sweet potatoes with butter and brown sugar and the pecan salmon. My father the beef lover was pleased with his steak. Service was excellent.  We will be back!

data.title: This place has seriously declined. Stay away for now.
data.text: What happened here? This place used to be a solid go-to. It's been a couple of years since we went and we were dismayed by what we found tonight. We went at 7:30pm on a Friday night, fully expecting to have to wait for a table, and we were fine with that. But when we got to the parking lot, it was half empty. Warning sign number one. We walked in and it was half empty. We assumed we would be given a table in the dining area but instead the hostess offered a high-top in the bar, which we declined, so apparently, without asking she decided we'd like a booth in the bar. She asked us to wait, even though half the dining area was empty, for her to clean off a booth in the bar. This took her at least 5 minutes. When she managed to get that done and seat us, the table was still wet with stinky water. I wiped it down with the one napkin that was provided for what was clearly a party of two. For whatever reason we were still willing to give it a shot because we had so many good times there over the years. But when my wife's menu stuck to the table, and my menu had pages inside stuck together from filth, we got up and walked away. We are so disappointed. This used to be a nice place, but I will not go back unless they have a very publicly announced change of management before I give them another chance. Seriously, a job very poorly done, Mr. or Ms.  Manager.

data.title: Birthday celebration
data.text: We visited this restaurant for a relative's birthday celebration.  The service was outstanding and the food and drinks were great. Being from out of state, we especially enjoyed the fresh walleye. Since it was a special birthday, we were given a large and tasty chocolate dessert on the house. We would definitely come back the next time we are in Minnesota.

data.title: First time here
data.text: I went here to eat my friend since we were in the cities shopping and wanted to try a new place to eat.  We came on a Saturday night after the rush. Had no problem finding a parking spot. Got seated within 5 minutes of arriving.  Prices were reasonable for the food. Both our food was delicious and excellent. I ordered the surf and turf. The twin medallions were excellent. Lots of flavor. The shrimp scampi was so yummy, I wanted to eat the tails. It comes with potato a gratin and grilled asparagus.  Perfect. My friend had the quarter chicken. It was delicious. She had mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus. Delicious she said as well. So wanted dessert, but too full.

data.title: Date night with my wife
data.text: The buffalo shrimp appetizer was fantastic. The flat breads were good, but I have had better. My burger was cooked to my order, but the whole burger was a bit dry.  My server was excellent, and he brought me some more blue cheese dressing for my burger.  It was a very nice evening with my wife.

data.title: Disappointed this visit
data.text:
We've been to this location in the past and were always happy, but not this time.
No greeting at the door (we stood at the hostess stand while 2 servers chatted at the POS station). Then when they were done the one, female, walks past us without saying a word, leaving the other to finish his business on the machine and then turn to greet us! Not a good start.
Server then tells us to 'grab a table' and he'll be right over with menus (looking around there was only 1 large group at a table just off the entrance, lots of people around the bar area). Manager brings us the menus and tells us the server will be right with us, he shows up approximately 4 minutes later.
After taking our drink order, and bringing them to us, I enquire if there are any specials, this being a Friday night after 9 pm we expected there to be as in the past.
Apparently they changed their menu to not include Friday or Saturday in any specials/promotional pricing (in the past they had half price appetizers and the place was always packed). Not sure if this is such a good business decision as the only people in the place, besides us, were sitting at the bar drinking, not eating.
This didn't deter us as we ordered anyway.
We each had a flatbread pizza, hers being a margarita (with pasta sauce) and mine pepperoni. They were good, just not great. Server did ask how everything was as he noticed that my fiancé didn't eat much of her pizza, we told him, all we got was a 'sorry'. Guess that's all we should expect, considering the lack of greeting at the door.

data.title: Might have to find a new happy hour place
data.text: Happy hour used to be $2 off drinks, and apps/flatbreads 1/2 off...great deal. Didn't read new menu closely enough apparently..got the bill and much more than usual for same items. Asked waiter about it and he says the new menu says apps are now "almost 1/2 off" but didn't know what that means. Never before have I seen a menu that doesn't clearly tell the price of something. Things that are 10.00 normally are 7.00 for example. The food was fine, server was great, but I don't like the tricky new menu and I'm in no hurry to go back for happy hour.

data.title: Another Business Trip to St. Paul
data.text: Stopped here for dinner with a business associate.  It was a Wednesday night and the place was more busy that I expected.  We went for the seafood.  I had the Walleye and my associate dined on the Cedar Plank Salmon.  Both were very good and the service was acceptable.

data.title: It's Been Awhile
data.text: My wife and I went with our daughter and two sons.  She had some dining points to use up We had Allison as our server who did an excellent job.  It is nice to see that some people take a job like this very seriously.  She worked hard for us and we appreciated it.  They have a make your own Bloody Mary bar for $7.  Pour in as much as you would like and as my of the condiments you can fit it in, or on top.  I had the Honey Wrap and substituted a tortilla soup for the fries.  Sandwich was good, and the soup was a bit spicy but still good.  There also was a mix-up on my order and I also received fries.  Oh, well!  My wife had the Bonfire Club sandwich with fries.  Food was a little slower in coming out, according to my daughter but was not excessively long.  We had not been here in a while but the experience was a good one.  Nothing earth shattering about the place, just nice.  Hostesses did a very nice job, waitress good, and manager stopped by, so those are plusses.  Reasonably priced

data.title: Great Location - Average Dining Experience
data.text: Nice venue with friendly service, but I can't say that anything jumps out at you to make you want to visit this establishment on a regular basis.   Food was OK - Portions were average and if something extra was needed, the staff gladly accommodated. We would return for a change of pace, but probably only a few times a year with all the various selections of restaurants in the area.
